text: A Mouthful of Air: Language and Languages, Especially English is a book on linguistics by Anthony Burgess, published in 1992. Its topics include the mechanics of linguistic sounds; the development of the English language and its connections with other languages; the making of dictionaries; the importance of slang; the International Phonetic Alphabet; the role of dialect; the best way to learn a foreign language; and a look at specific languages, including Russian Japanese and Malay. ==References== Category:Books by Anthony Burgess Category:Linguistics books Category:1992 non-fiction books Category:Hutchinson (publisher) books
